intro: Ottelia guanyangensis, commonly known as the Guanyang water plant, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its submerged, ribbon-like leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow freshwater environments such as ponds and wetlands. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ottelia guanyangensis is considered a vulnerable species.
